meanings.definition: Fastened or attached with a tack.
meanings.sent1: The tacked paper stayed securely on the wall.
meanings.sent2: She wore a tacked dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The tacked sign on the door made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His tacked drawing added a pop of color to the room.
meanings.sent5: The tacked note reminded her of the important task.

meanings.definition: Changed direction by sailing into the wind.
meanings.sent1: The boat tacked smoothly against the breeze.
meanings.sent2: They tacked to avoid the rocks near the shore.
meanings.sent3: The sailor tacked skillfully, impressing the crew.
meanings.sent4: She tacked the sail just in time to catch the wind.
meanings.sent5: Tacking around the buoy, they gained speed.

meanings.definition: Added as an extra feature or detail.
meanings.sent1: The tacked ribbon made the gift look special.
meanings.sent2: He wore a tacked hat for the costume party.
meanings.sent3: The tacked buttons on the jacket were a fun touch.
meanings.sent4: Her tacked necklace completed the outfit perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The tacked design on the cake was a delightful surprise.
